result.execSummary:
The defendant Olajuwon D Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Olajuwon D Brown is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Olajuwon D Brown was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to give DNA sample

Fine of $500.00 including all mandatory  costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge to be paid by 10-26-15 or serve 25 consecutive days in the House of Correction.

Court will grant motion for expungement if defendant pays the fine and brings the motion to the court.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Olajuwon D Brown in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

Defendant to give DNA sample

Fine of $500.00 including all mandatory  costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge to be paid by 10-26-15 or serve 25 consecutive days in the House of Correction.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed. 

Court will grant  motion for expungement if defendant pays the fine and brings the motion to the court.

Attorney Torrie R. Williams in court.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State requested different sentencing date.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-26-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Olajuwon D Brown in court with attorney  Dawn Rablin for Torrie R. Williams.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

AS TO COUNT TWO: 
 Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

ON MOTION OF THE STATE, COURT ORDERED COUNT ONE:  DISMISSED. 
  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47. lr  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-20-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Olajuwon D Brown in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties ready to proceed to trial. Final pretrial held. Case remains set for Jury Trial on 7/15/2015 at 8:30 am.

Defendant Olajuwon D Brown in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests an adjournment. Court granted defense request. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Status conference scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Olajuwon D Brown in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Alyssa M. Schaller  with student appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch   47. lr  Status conference scheduled for 05-27-2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Olajuwon D Brown in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  
Defendant Olajuwon D Brown in custody. 
 Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
